title: Breaking Bad and Jackie Brown star Robert Forster dies aged 78
text:

Breaking Bad and Jackie Brown star Robert Forster has died aged 78.

The Oscar-nominated veteran actor died from brain cancer - the day his new film, the Breaking Bad movie El Camino was released.

Forster was born in Rochester, New York, and began training to become an actor at the University of Rochester, where he was as a law student.

He would earn a Bachelor of Arts degree and took starring roles in the student drama productions.

Forster landed a role on Broadway before appearing Reflections In A Golden Eye by John Huston, which would spark his long career.

He became one of the most recognisable faces of the TV shows and movies he starred in, taking on all manner of genres from The Delta Force to The Black Hole.

Quentin Tarantino was so taken by his acting that he created the role of Max Cherry with him mind, when he was writing Jackie Brown.

It helped Forster find a whole new audience which led him to the role of Ed Galbraith, or The Disappearer on Breaking Bad.

Speaking about his acting, Forster once said: "You’ve got to have a good attitude. Accept all things, deliver excellence to whatever is offered, give it your best shot.

"And never quit. It’s not over 'til it’s over."

description: Oscar-nominated actor Forster, 78, died of brain cancer after starring in likes of Twin Peaks and Heroes
